definition:
Regional and local
anesthesia, which blocks transmission of &%Nerve impulses from a specific part
of the body. Depending on the situation, this may be used either on its own (in
which case the individual remains fully conscious), or in combination with
general anesthesia or sedation. Local anesthesia is simple infiltration by the
clinician directly onto the region of interest (e.g. numbing a &%Tooth for
dental work). Peripheral nerve blocks use drugs targeted at peripheral nerves to
anesthetize an isolated part of the body, such as an entire &%Limb. Neuraxial
blockade , mainly epidural and spinal anesthesia, can be performed in the region
of the central nervous system itself, suppressing all incoming sensation from
nerves supplying the area of the block. [from Wikipedia]
